title.native: 夜明け前より瑠璃色な -Crescent Love-
title.romaji: Yoake Mae Yori Ruriiro na: Crescent Love

description:
Feena Fam Earthlight will have you seeing stars! It's hard enough being from the Moon, but it's even harder when you're in love with an Earthling! Watch as two worlds collide when this space princess makes her landing on Earth!

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: Yoake Mae Yori Ruri Iro na: Crescent Love

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

node.description:
**Height:**163cm

[Profile (Ken Production)](http://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/member.php?mem=w42) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/nabatamehitomi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_nabacan_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naba3po/)

She was part of the seiyuu unit with [Shizuka Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/95093/) called "Hitomi Nabatame to Shizuka Itou" (生天目仁美と伊藤静) under Geneon's cosmic★motion label. Together they are known by the name Hitoshizuku (ひとしずく).

__Non-Anime Roles:__

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

Yuuka Maniwa is a color designer.

__[Blog (JP)](http://unisen.blog.shinobi.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuriko_m)__

__Graduated:__ Ferris University

__Yuriko Mutou__, better known as Yuriko Mori, is a Japanese lyricist.

**August** (オーガスト, Ōgasuto?)  is a Japanese visual novel studio under the publisher Hazuki. On the Internet, August is known by the slang term Hachigatsu (八月?). Hazuki and Hachigatsu mean August in Japanese.
